Deployed production-grade async task queue on BlackRoad Pi cluster:

COMPONENTS (alice 192.168.4.49):
- Redis (Docker, port 6379)
- Task Queue API v2 (systemd, port 8010)
- Task Worker v2 (systemd, multi-queue)

FEATURES:
- Multi-queue routing: cpu, hailo, inference
- ULID IDs (time-sortable, 26 chars)
- Typed payload/result (no JSON strings)
- Idempotency keys + deduplication
- Worker registration + attribution
- Distributed claim locks (30s TTL)
- Worker heartbeat (10s interval)
- Retry tracking (attempts/max_attempts)
- TTL + expires_at (auto-cleanup)
- Constraints (timeout_ms, max_output_bytes)
- Priority field (0-100)
- Systemd hardening (NoNewPrivileges, MemoryMax, CPUQuota)

REDIS KEYS:
- br:task:{ULID} - Task hash (v2 schema)
- br:q:cpu/hailo/inference - Queue lists
- br:lock:{ULID} - Claim locks (30s TTL)
- br:idem:{key} - Idempotency mapping
- br:worker:{id} - Worker registration (120s TTL)

API ENDPOINTS:
- POST /agents/tasks - Submit task
- GET /agents/tasks - List tasks
- GET /agents/tasks/{id} - Get task
- DELETE /agents/tasks/{id} - Cancel
- GET /agents/stats - Queue depths + workers
- GET /agents/workers - Worker status

TRAEFIK ROUTE: /agents/* -> 192.168.4.49:8010

Worker w-alice-* watching queues: cpu, inference
Caps: cpu, localai

Next: Wire into /status cockpit
